net.dean.jraw.auth

Class AuthenticationManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.dean.jraw.auth.AuthenticationManager

  • public final class AuthenticationManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Helps developers manage the OAuth2 authentication process better, especially if the app will need to be reauthenticated using a refresh token. For apps that do not use refresh tokens (such as script and application only apps), this class may be a bit over the top. However, if need be, an ApatheticTokenStore can be used to initialize the manager.

    This class attempts to manage a synchronous RedditClient in an asynchronous environment such as how Android is encouraged to run in. AuthenticationManager's singleton instance can be retrieved using get(). If the developer wants to make use of the class, they must first initialize it with a call to init(RedditClient, RefreshTokenHandler).

    This class is designed to make authentication easier, especially when dealing with refresh tokens. Refresh tokens will automatically be stored in a TokenStore as long as the RedditClient calls onAuthenticated(OAuthData). A call to checkAuthState() will tell a developer exactly what the library knows and how the developer can go about getting the client authenticated.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      AuthenticationState checkAuthState()
      Evaluates the manager's RedditClient and TokenStore to determine the current authentication state
      static AuthenticationManager get() 
      RedditClient getRedditClient()
      Gets the lazy-initialized global RedditClient
      void init(RedditClient reddit, RefreshTokenHandler tokenHandler)
      Initializes the AuthenticationManager.
      void onAuthenticated(OAuthData o)
      Writes the OAuthData's refresh token to the RefreshTokenHandler.
      void refreshAccessToken(Credentials credentials)
      If a refresh token exists already, this method will retrieve a new access token and update the RedditClient with the new information

      • get

        public static AuthenticationManager get()

      • init

        public void init(RedditClient reddit,
        RefreshTokenHandler tokenHandler)
        Initializes the AuthenticationManager. Must be called before this class can be used. Sets the RedditClient's AuthenticationListener.

      • getRedditClient

        public RedditClient getRedditClient()
        Gets the lazy-initialized global RedditClient

      • checkAuthState

        public AuthenticationState checkAuthState()
        Evaluates the manager's RedditClient and TokenStore to determine the current authentication state
        See Also:
        AuthenticationState

      • refreshAccessToken

        public void refreshAccessToken(Credentials credentials)
                        throws NoSuchTokenException,
                               OAuthException
        If a refresh token exists already, this method will retrieve a new access token and update the RedditClient with the new information
        Parameters:
        credentials - The Credentials used to request the initial access token
        Throws:
        NoSuchTokenException
        OAuthException

      • onAuthenticated

        public void onAuthenticated(OAuthData o)
        Writes the OAuthData's refresh token to the RefreshTokenHandler. For optimal results this method should be called by the RedditClient's implementation of RedditClient.authenticate(OAuthData).
